bibl.title: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Philip Showalter Hench, June 21, 1948

div1.p: Lyons sends Hench a copy of the photograph of Lawrence and Blossom Reed unveiling the Walter Reed bust.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Philip Showalter Hench, June 21, 1948
div1.opener:
Every American is a shareholder in the Hall of Fame
HALL OF FAME : NEW YORK UNIVERSITY
I MADISON AVENUE · NEW YORK I0, N.Y.
Telephone: MURRAY HILL 3-4469
21 June 1948.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
It was good to have your letter of the
14th of June, with its complimentary messages from the
Reed family, and General Kean. I am delighted to
know that you, too, approved of the program.

I am now sending you a glossy print showing the
unveiling of the bronze by General Reed. It was the
only group photograph which was made the day of the unveil-
ing.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Bertha L. Lyons
Assistant to the Director Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
